facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

The years 2015 and 2017 also show multiple publications, indicating continued interest and research activity in the field of sensemaking.
The dataset spans from 1999 to 2019, showing that sensemaking has been a topic of interest for at least two decades, with varying levels of research output over the years.

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

The dataset spans from 1999 to 2019, showing that sensemaking has been a topic of interest for at least two decades, with varying levels of research output over the years.

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
publications_per_year = sensemaking_papers['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(publications_per_year.index, publications_per_year.values, marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Publications Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(sensemaking_papers)}")
print("Publications per year:")
print(publications_per_year)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of publications per year
publications_per_year = sensemaking_papers['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trend
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.plot(publications_per_year.index, publications_per_year.values, marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Publications Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(sensemaking_papers)}")
print("Publications per year:")
print(publications_per_year)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset

# Filter papers related to sensemaking

yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Count the number of sensemaking papers per year
sensemaking_trends = sensemaking_papers['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sensemaking_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Publications Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the trends
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Trends in the number of sensemaking publications over the years:")
print(sensemaking_trends)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the trends in the number of publications related to sensemaking over the years in the dataset?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Print the results

for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd

print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(sensemaking_papers)}")
print("Publications per year:")
print(publications_per_year)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and count the number of publications
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
yearly_trends.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title('Trends in Number of Publications Related to Sensemaking')

plt.ylabel('Number of Publications')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()

print(f"Years with publications: {yearly_trends.index.tolist()}")
print(f"Number of publications each year: {yearly_trends.values.tolist()}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author keywords associated with sensemaking research in this dataset, and how have they evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_032543/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path)

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract and count author keywords
keywords = sensemaking_papers['AuthorKeywords'].dropna().str.split(', ')
all_keywords = [keyword for sublist in keywords for keyword in sublist]
keyword_counts = Counter(all_keywords)

# Get the most common keywords
most_common_keywords = keyword_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of keywords over the years
keyword_evolution = sensemaking_papers.groupby('Year')['AuthorKeywords'].apply(lambda x: ', '.join(x.dropna()))

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common keywords associated with sensemaking research:")
for keyword, count in most_common_keywords:
    print(f"{keyword}: {count} occurrences")

print("\nEvolution of keywords over the years:")
for year, keywords in keyword_evolution.items():
    print(f"{year}: {keywords}")
print("### End of facts")
